pages.text: Beam Diverters can change the direction a charged particle beam goes. Doing so the particle beam losses a small amount of energy to synchrotron radiation.

pages.title: Constuction
pages.text: Beam Diverters are a 5x5x5 cube of accelerator casing that has a dipole filling the centre. The dipole can also be in the vertical direction. All the same requirements of a accelerator are required. So it must have a Coolant vent in input output mode and an energy port. The Beam Diverters does not need coolers in them.

pages.title: Operation
pages.text: To Start the Beam Diverter just give the controller a redstone signal. Like Sycrotrons the input and output beam ports can be selected with a redstone pulse see Beam ports for more detail.

pages.title: Particle Energy
pages.text: The Maximum particle energy (in GeV) the Beam Diverter can bend is Ef=(qBdR)^2/(2m) where q is the particle charge, Bd is the dipole strength (this depends on what electromagnet you use), R is the Beam diverters effective radius (this by default is 160 but can be set in the configs) and m is the mass of the particle in MeV/c^2.
The amount of Energy lost by a particle bent in the Beam Diverter is Eloss= Eq^2/(6m^4*R^2) Note: the energy loss only occurs when the beam is bent if it goes straight through no energy is lost.
